page.title: 11PART OF DARRINGTON-WENTHILLS
page.content: Only part of Darrington is covered by our survey. The centre of the village, including the Church and the School are in the next section. Darrington lies about one and a half miles out of Pontefract. It is about the same distance from the A1/M62 Junction. This part of the village is overshadowed by the flyover. Most of the housing is modern. There are both bungalows and houses. The housing looks expensive. Darrington Hall is privately owned. It was used as a hospital for ex-servicemen after the 1914-18 War. The Darrington Hotel lies on the sliproad for the A1. It is dependant on the road for its trade. There are two shops in this area, the Farm Shop, and a D-I-Y shop and timber yard.
